vendors.name: ClickHouse
vendors.description: Open-source columnar OLAP database optimized for real-time analytics with security-specific advantages (native IP types, 50-100× CIDR query speedup).
vendors.cost_notes: OSS self-hosted free. ClickHouse Cloud: consumption-based. Enterprise support: $50K-150K/year. TCO varies with scale.

evidence_sources.description: Uber production: 100+ trillion events, powers real-time analytics for 1B+ rides, sub-second query performance
Query Performance: Cloudflare production: 96% queries <1s, 6M req/sec
Query Performance: Shell security telemetry: 57TB/day production scale
Compression Efficiency: 10-12× compression typical, 75-85% storage reduction vs Elasticsearch

vendors.name: Trino
vendors.description: Open-source distributed SQL query engine for federated analytics across heterogeneous data sources (S3, databases, APIs). Formerly PrestoSQL.
vendors.cost_notes: OSS free. Infrastructure: $50-100K/year. Commercial support (Starburst): $100K+/year.

evidence_sources.description: Bloomberg production: Petabyte-scale queries, powers financial analytics, Meta (Facebook) origin validation
Query Performance: Meta production: petabyte-scale queries, 10-100× faster than Hive
Query Performance: O'Reilly book: Authoritative Trino reference
Federation: 40+ connectors documented (S3, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Elasticsearch, etc.)

vendors.name: Microsoft Azure Sentinel
vendors.description: Cloud-native SIEM with AI-powered threat intelligence and automated response. Deep integration with Microsoft ecosystem (E5, Defender, Azure).
vendors.cost_notes: Ingestion: $12K/month. Retention (365 days): $18K/month. Search jobs: $1-5K/month. Total: $31-35K/month.

evidence_sources.description: Gartner Magic Quadrant for SIEM 2024: Microsoft Azure Sentinel positioned as Leader (same as Microsoft Sentinel)
Threat Detection: Built-in AI/ML for anomaly detection, UEBA (User and Entity Behavior Analytics)
Cost Model Transparency: Complex pricing: ingestion + retention + search jobs. $2.46/GB ingestion, $0.03/GB retention, $0.0062/GB scanned

vendors.name: Amazon Athena
vendors.description: Serverless interactive SQL query engine for analyzing data in Amazon S3. Pay-per-query pricing ($5/TB scanned) ideal for cost-conscious teams. Native Iceberg support enables partitioning optimizations that reduce scan costs 70-90%.
vendors.cost_notes: $5 per TB scanned. Optimized with Iceberg partitioning to reduce scan costs 70-90%. No infrastructure costs (serverless).

evidence_sources.description: Forrester Wave for Cloud Data Warehouse 2024: Amazon Athena recognized as Strong Performer
Serverless Simplicity: Zero infrastructure management, automatic scaling, pay-per-query model
Iceberg Native Support: Native Iceberg support launched 2022. Full read/write/delete/merge operations.
Iceberg Native Support: Athena Iceberg performance validated in Starburst comparison
Cost Predictability: Marcus Journey: Athena $5/TB pricing enables budget predictability

vendors.name: Apache Iceberg
vendors.description: Open table format for huge analytic datasets. Winner of format wars with universal multi-engine support (Spark, Trino, Flink, Snowflake, Athena). ACID transactions, time travel, schema evolution, hidden partitioning enable production data lakehouse architectures.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source (Apache License). Infrastructure-only costs (storage + compute engines). Lowest operational overhead. No licensing fees.

evidence_sources.description: Apple production: Exabyte-scale lakehouse, powers Apple services analytics, format wars winner validation
Production Scale Performance: SK Telecom production: 97% query time reduction, 52.7TB processed in 3.39 seconds
Production Scale Performance: Netflix: 100+ petabytes on Iceberg, open sourced 2018, powers all analytics
Multi Engine Compatibility: Universal engine support: Spark, Trino, Flink, Athena, Snowflake, Databricks, Dremio, StarRocks
Multi Engine Compatibility: Iceberg won format wars: Universal adoption vs Delta (Databricks-specific) and Hudi
Hidden Partitioning Acid: Hidden partitioning eliminates user partition management. Automatic partition evolution. ACID guarantees.

vendors.name: Snowflake Data Cloud
vendors.description: Cloud-native data warehouse with lakehouse capabilities. Multi-cloud support (AWS, Azure, GCP), Iceberg support, strong data governance and sharing. Consumption-based pricing with managed service simplicity.
vendors.cost_notes: Consumption pricing (compute + storage). Costs can escalate with inefficient queries or continuous compute. Typical security workload: $50-150/TB/month all-in.

evidence_sources.description: Gartner Magic Quadrant for Cloud Database Management Systems 2024: Snowflake positioned as Leader
Iceberg Support: Snowflake Iceberg Tables announced 2023, native read/write support
Iceberg Support: Dremio 2024 survey: Snowflake among vendors announcing Iceberg compatibility
Multi Cloud Support: Runs natively on AWS, Azure, Google Cloud with identical experience
Data Governance: Built-in data governance: row-level security, column masking, tag-based policies, data sharing

vendors.name: Databricks Lakehouse Platform
vendors.description: Unified analytics platform built on Apache Spark with Delta Lake and Unity Catalog governance. Strong ML/AI capabilities, multi-cloud support (AWS, Azure, GCP), acquired Tabular (Iceberg creators) for universal format support.
vendors.cost_notes: Consumption pricing (DBUs + storage). Strong ML capabilities justify premium for data science-heavy use cases. TCO analysis shows lakehouse advantage over traditional platforms.

evidence_sources.description: Gartner Magic Quadrant for Data Science and Machine Learning Platforms 2024: Databricks positioned as Leader
Ml Ai Native: Native ML capabilities: MLflow, AutoML, Feature Store, Model Serving integrated
Delta Lake Iceberg Support: Acquired Tabular (Iceberg creators) 2023, adding native Iceberg support to Delta Lake platform
Delta Lake Iceberg Support: Dremio 2024 survey: Databricks announcing Iceberg compatibility alongside Delta Lake
Unity Catalog Governance: Unity Catalog: Unified governance for data and AI across clouds, open-sourced 2024

evidence_sources.description: Production customers: Pitney Bowes, AlphaSense, Faire, Block (fintech), Handshake, Productboard
SOC 2 (Security, Confidentiality, Availability) certified, enterprise-scale metadata infrastructure

vendors.name: DataHub
vendors.description: Open-source metadata platform built by LinkedIn for data discovery, observability, and federated governance. Active community with scalable ingestion connector framework. User-friendly interface for asset search, interactive lineage graphs. Requires substantial infrastructure resources.
vendors.cost_notes: OSS self-hosted free. Acryl Data (commercial): managed DataHub Cloud with enterprise features. Typical managed: $30K-100K/year. Infrastructure costs for self-hosted: multiple components require substantial resources.

evidence_sources.description: Built by LinkedIn, leading open-source data catalog, active community with scalable connector framework
Integrating with existing data ecosystems can be challenging, requires substantial infrastructure resources

vendors.name: Panther
vendors.description: Cloud-native, serverless SIEM platform transforming terabytes of raw logs into structured security data lake for real-time detection. Customers: Dropbox, Gusto, Asana, Snyk, HubSpot, Loom, Coinbase. Usage-based pricing. Lower TCO than traditional SIEM (Splunk $1M+/year vs Panther).
vendors.cost_notes: Usage-based pricing (data volume). 36-month standard term. Lower TCO than Splunk ($1M+/year). One customer saved significantly vs previous product on 3-year contract. Contact sales@panther.com for custom pricing.

evidence_sources.description: Production customers: Dropbox, Gusto, Asana, Snyk, HubSpot, Loom, Coinbase
Lower TCO than traditional SIEM (Splunk $1M+/year), customer saved money on 3-year contract

vendors.name: Tenzir
vendors.description: Open-source security data pipeline with MCP-enabled AI parser generation for automated OCSF mapping. AWS-native deployment for Security Lake.
vendors.cost_notes: Open source execution engine. Enterprise support and cloud deployment extra.
vendors.evidence_source: Tenzir LinkedIn announcement at AWS re:Invent 2025

vendors.name: Estuary
vendors.description: Real-time data pipeline platform with CDC and streaming capabilities. Cost-effective alternative for terabyte-scale workloads.
vendors.cost_notes: Significantly cheaper than $200K/year incumbent for terabyte monthly workloads
vendors.evidence_source: Seattle Data Guy LinkedIn post Dec 3, 2025

vendors.cost_notes: Part of Databricks platform. OLTP adds to compute costs.
